results.title: John Lee Hooker: that's my story
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the life and times of famous Afro-American blues musician John Lee Hooker. Born in the heart of the Mississippi Delta Hooker went on to become a famous, influential and highly respected player. Made for television this documentary features interviews with many of Hooker’s music peers, including Carlos Santana, Eric Clapton, Bonnie Rait, Edie Kirkland and Robert Cray. Various artists discuss the influence of Hooker on their music and the remarkable life and times of this great artist. Family and friends discuss the cultural influence of Hooker and the effect that he had on them personally. Features a current interview with Hooker as well as archival footage of him playing in the 1950s. Songs include Dimples, Maudie, I’m in the mood, Crawlin’ Kingsnake, This is hip and Boogie chillin. John Lee Hooker died in 2001, at the age of 83.

results.title: Memento [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Jennifer Todd, Suzanne Todd and Newmarket Films
results.brief_description: The second feature by Christopher Nolan accomplishes what seems impossible: to tell a movie backwards. Leonard (Guy Pearce) is a former Insurance Investigator whose successful career was cut short by a violent incident which deprived him of his ability to make new memories, transforming his life into an epic quest for vengeance. But his mental condition makes him vulnerable to those who would take advantage, and the lengths to which he’ll go to give his life some logic prove frightening. A disorienting but ultimately ingenious thriller. Cast also includes Joe Pantoliano and Carrie-Anne Moss.

results.title: Legally blonde
results.creator_credit: Robert Luketic, Marc Platt, Ric Kidney and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A lively comedy by Australian filmmaker, and Swinburne graduate, Robert Luketic. Reese Witherspoon stars as fashion merchandising graduate, Elle Woods, eagerly anticipating a marriage proposal from her politically ambitious boyfriend, Warner Huntington III (Matthew Davis). When he dumps her to search for a woman more suited to the role of senator’s wife, Elle sets out to win him back. Determined to improve her chances by becoming his intellectual equal, she enrols into Harvard Law School after her vibrant application impresses the admissions board. Her Southern Californian Bimbo appearance, bubbly personality and casual approach to study set her apart from the other Ivy League students. Initially an outcast, Elle’s blonde ambition eventually secures her reputation as a force to be reckoned with, propelling her to the top of her class. Cast also includes: Luke Wilson, Selma Blair and Raquel Welch. Screenplay by Karen McCullah Lutz and Kirsten Smith, based on the book by Amanda Brown. Cinematography, Anthony B. Richmond.

constellations_other.name: The Third Place
constellations_other.description: Explore how Eddie’s Lil’ Homies fits into the broader history of the third place on screen, demonstrating how public spaces away from home, work and school are important sites for friendship, community building and support across generations.

constellations_other.name: Pink subversions
constellations_other.description: Pink dominates Angela Tiatia's The Dark Current. The artist describes this particular colour as “artificial”, “unapologetic” and “pulsating with feminine energy”. In Tiatia's Sāmoan heritage “there is a brashness in the use of colour. I really wanted to embody that.”

results.title: The Night of the hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Laughton, Paul Gregory, United Artists Corporation and James Agee
results.brief_description: On its initial release “The Night of the Hunter” shocked audiences and critics with its combination of lyrical imagery and sadistic violence. However, this masterpiece of horror, directed by actor Charles Laughton and based on a script by author and critic, James Agee, remains one of the most astonishingly beautiful and disturbing films ever made. Two young children are thrown into a nightmarish world when their mother (Shelley Winters), remarries a psychopathic preacher (Robert Mitchum), murder forces them to flee and seek refuge with an old woman (the magnificent Lillian Gish). As the preacher pursues them through the rural splendour of the South, the suspense and terror intensifies to an almost surreal pitch. Also stars James Gleason, Evelyn Varden and Peter Graves. Cinematography is by the master of light, Stanley Cortez. Mitchum’s frightening central performance is possibly the finest work of his career. Based on the novel by Davis Grubb. Music by Walter Schumann.

results.title: New year sacrifice = Zhu fu [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Sang Hu and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: A tragic story that highlights the humiliations and hardships endured by women in traditional Chinese society, focusing on the life of a twice widowed, middle-aged village woman. Her last hopes of happiness are shattered by the news of the death her son. Cast includes Yang Bai and Wei Heling. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Based on the original work by the famous writer Lu Xun.

results.title: Henry VIII and his six wives
results.creator_credit: Waris Hussein, Roy Baird and Anglo-EMI Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the BBC television miniseries “The Six wives of Henry VIII” this feature film version combines what was a very successful television series into an equally entertaining and well-received film. It has a quality of richness and power and yet at the same time offers a human, almost vulnerable, side to Henry as he desperately searches for a wife who can produce a son and heir to the throne of England. His life is continually surrounded by plots and conspiracies from those who have ulterior motives as to who Henry should marry. Donald Pleasence puts in an excellent performance as Thomas Cromwell and Keith Michell is truly magnificent as Henry VIII as he physically changes from a proud young man to a quite obese and gout-ridden lonely old man. The six wives are played equally as well by Frances Cuka (Catharine of Aragon), Charlotte Rampling (Anne Boleyn), Jane Asher (Jane Seymour), Jenny Bos (Anne of Cleves), Lynne Frederick (Catharine Howard) and Barbara Leigh-Hunt (Catharine Parr).

results.title: He died with a felafel in his hand
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Andrew McPhail, Domenico Procacci and Notorious Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Noah Taylor), onto his 49th share house and in his mid 30s is probably ready for some privacy and independence but is still attracted to the friends and oddball characters that makes sharing a house so attractively horrible. We travel with Danny as he moves through shared houses in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Danny’s life is further complicated by the presence of rental goons despatched by landlords in search of unpaid rent and the police chasing him in relation to a credit card debt thanks to a dodgy housemate. Proving he is not responsible is harder than lying about his identity. Based on the book of the same name by John Birmingham, `He Died With A Felafel In His Hand’ is a wonderful satire on shared housing. Cast also includes Romane Bohringer, Emily Hamilton, Sophie Lee, Alex Menglet and Damien Walshe Howling.

results.title: Last gasp
results.creator_credit: Scott McGinnis, Stanley Isaacs, Castel Films, Kushner-Locke and Warner Vision Films
results.brief_description: A second-rate horror film which unfortunately does not match some of those wonderful “B” graders of the 1950s. The plot centres around the supernatural, the mystical, the spiritual beliefs of the Totec Indian tribe of Mexico who, as legend goes, live forever when their spirit escapes from their body with their last dying breath and possesses the nearest human. Leslie Chase (Robert Patrick), a ruthless and determined property developer working on a construction project in Santa Del Soz, Mexico, is fed up with the local Totec Indians harassing him and after two of his workers are murdered, Chase has the whole tribe of Indians massacred. Unfortunately for Chase, one of the Indians survives to make a surprise attack on him, biting him on the neck. Chase kills him but not before the Indian has time to expel his last gasp. Six years later in Boone County, Pennsylvania, Chase, still the same arrogant avaricious property developer by day, is cursed by the sacrificial spirit of the tribe in his body by night, filling him with the need to kill, and keep killing. His series of murders eventually lead to suspicion and an investigation by a woman, Nora Weeks (Joanna Pacula), whose husband has gone missing. There is a bit of sex, a bit of blood and guts and really not a lot of horror. Filmed entirely on location in Romania. Cast also includes Vyto Ruginis, Mimi Craven, Alexander Enberg, Nan Martin, Shashawnee Hall.

results.title: The War against the Indians
results.creator_credit: Harry Rasky and Canadian Broadcast Company
results.brief_description: War against the Indians traces the history of North American Indians from 40,000 years ago to the present day. Harry Rasky, writer, producer, director and narrator, questions many of the traditional beliefs about Indians from the point of view of Native Americans. Did Christopher Columbus discover the North American Indians? Don’t you have to be lost to be discovered? The North American Indians were already established and living off the land of North America, perhaps it was they who discovered Christopher Columbus and not the other way round. This documentary, put together with paintings, music, photographs and interviews reflects on their history.

results.title: The Raven
results.creator_credit: Louis Friedlander, Carl Laemmle and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A macabre horror classic from a story by Edgar Allen Poe, “The Raven” centres on a brilliant but unstable surgeon, Dr Richard Vollin (Bela Lugosi), with a morbid obsession for instruments of torture. When Jean Thatcher (Irene Ware), daughter of Judge Thatcher (Samuel S. Hinds) is injured in a car accident, it is Dr Vollin who steps in and saves her life. However, the beautiful Jean becomes frightened of Vollin’s increasing attraction and advances towards her and pleads to her father to ask Vollin to leave her alone. Vollin’s rejection turns to revenge when by chance, an escaped killer, Edmond Bateman (Boris Karloff), approaches the surgeon for a new face. Bateman unwittingly becomes a victim of Vollin’s sinister plan for the kidnap, torture and death of Jean and her fiance. This original version of “The Raven”, through its use of black and white cinematography, brings out the evil and horror in Poe’s classic tale - shadowy silhouettes, dark stormy nights, howling winds, flashes of lightning, hidden dungeons, torture chambers - all the necessary ingredients, plus the superb, if somewhat melodramatic, acting by the cast, particularly Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi. Cast also includes Lester Matthews, Inez Courtney, Spencer Charters, Ian Wolfe, Maidel Turner. Screenplay by David Boehm.
